review.title: “Great company, great people!”
review.pros: Pros – Open talk policy- simple to get in touch with upper management and they always respond. In fact, they're always personable. Over time, I built many professional relationships with my regionals, vice president, district manager and co-managers within my district. I loved my district manager and regional as well as my merchant manager.Great pay and PTO- (Paid Time Off) Full time exempt employees start with 20 days and with seniority bumps up to 25. Great benefits and discounts on awesome clothing. This is definitely a career oriented company (for most people). Flexible schedule most of the time, each store has sufficient managers so you can easily take time off, change your work schedule. You are mandated to work only 40/hours a week.Simple policies/procedures and good corporate structure- Simple yet challenging work environment- perfect for people and self development. Anything you do know or need to know, they give you all resources to find it out. This is a strong company and many opportunities are available.I love this company! It isn't for everyone but if you can find your place, it's a mutual love!
review.cons: Cons – The company is growing and expanding so things are a little chaotic at times and the workload can be a little overwhelming. You just have to take some weeks day by day (sometimes hour by hour) and prioritize!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Turnover. Turnover. Turnover. I get it! The retail industry is changing but it's part of our job to build a rock solid team to grow the business. You are supposed to grow your team through people and self development. This is our job as business leaders! I know this isn't a career choice for very part timer but if morale is up- business is up as well! I started in a store where every manager was ten or more years senior and we made bonus almost every month, the workload diminished their quality of life and they left. This also occurred in every store within my district within two years. QUALITY OF LIFE.

review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Instead of the employee having to call in two hours before their shift to see if they need you, they should call you. My store is small, I must admit, but a 4 hour week with 1 associate working with a manager is really tough and lack-of-motivation inspiring. Yeah, sales will look good on the individual- but the store won't look nice because you're too busy selling hence the low amount of employees working.The managers and co-workers are really nice. I have a pleasure working with everyone. Although there are still people I've barely worked with and I've been with the company for 10 months.Also, my store has gone through 5 managers the past 8 months. It's been hectic.There should be away to obtain your work schedule online instead of having to go into the store to get it. They won't even give it to you over phone unless it's completely necessary.Discount is nice, but I never get to use it because I don't make enough money from the job to be able to spend it on.I did get a raise, which was nice. It was low, but it's the thought that counts.If you want to work here, do not depend on this to be your only job. You'll be grateful if you get a 10 hour week.

review.cons: Cons – Too much micromanaging from the corporate level. Too many directives and not enough freedom for managers to do what they feel is right for their store. Little incentives: taking away commissioned sales.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Manage according to the needs of your store. Cities with low salary demographics require extra efforts such as elevated customer service as opposed to cities where J.Crew is so well known that it sells itself. I find it absurd that my store director would prefer that I fold clothes over assisting customers, but she did.

review.title: “One of the hottest retailers to be working for at the moment”
review.pros: Pros – Fast-paced environment that allows you to meet and help a variety of different personalities. Management really emphasizes that we all work together as a team and communicate effectively, which makes everything run pretty smoothly, even during holiday. I was able to move from support to associate within 6 months, which was a great way to go. Knowing how the back/stock and register end works has really helped me as a seller. I have one of the greatest management teams, and they've been extremely accommodating with my college class schedule.
review.cons: Cons – The holiday season can be really, really tough to get through. I worked the four days before and two days after Christmas without a break, and it was pretty brutal. And immediately after holiday, hours drop off almost completely, which I didn't mind with my homework, but it really hurt some of the other employees.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It's amazing how smooth everything has been running thus far! Keep doing what you're doing, but make sure to keep an eye on support and sellers, because they're the absolute backbone of a store. In the grand scheme of things, we're seen as slaves, but it's better than most retailers ever treat their employees

The company also clearly wants frequent feedback from the employees, and the managers at the store I worked at definitely had my back. I felt valued as an employee.
review.cons: Cons – Pays not great. Otherwise pretty good work environment. I only left because I was going back to school.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Great company keep doing what you do.

Crew gives the employee a lot of autonomy in regards to customer service and there is a sense that "the store is your kingdom." The management is always eager for feedback, positive or negative and very frequently acts on that feedback.Performance based pay is also very nice.
review.cons: Cons – The only negative is the strict visual requirements the stores must maintain. This removes much of the creative process from the employee and results is a workplace that tends to become "stale" from a visual standpoint.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Best advice I could offer is to expand the Blue Martini/iPad aspect of training. review.cons: Cons – Regional team management 'played favourites.' No scope for corporate mobility or advancing careers within the company. I worked with the company throughout my college education and repeatedly inquired about internships and higher level positions to no avail.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Just wasn't for me.”
review.pros: Pros – You get a discount on the clothes... That's about it. I guess for lazy/vapid people, this is a great job.
review.cons: Cons – I hated the customers. It's really irksome to pretend to care about what clothes people are buying on a daily basis. But to those of you that like that sort of thing... it's a really nice job.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I have none. Management was really kind and considerate.

review.title: “i suggest you work here”
review.pros: Pros – great environment! I really enjoye it.
review.cons: Cons – a little too busy in new york for the management to oversee particulars and their strengths and possibly weeknesses
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Recognize that i'm a great employee

review.title: “Fantastic”
review.pros: Pros – Great discounts, Fun people, exciting company. Very great
review.cons: Cons – None...Some snooty VPS though.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – None! =)

review.employee-type: Sales Associate, Assistant to Visual Manager (Former Employee)
review.title: “This was a good retail experience, I learned a lot, and took full advantage of the sizable discount offered.”
review.pros: Pros – The people that I worked with were professional but also fun and easy going. I got the opportunity to work overnights to make window displays. Management consistently arranged sales contests for us so that things would stay interesting.
review.cons: Cons – I was disappointed in how much emphasis was put on selling the jcrew credit card. Employees are not allowed to have one, it is not a particularly good deal in my opinion for customers, and management expects you to "overcome objections" when people don't want to open one.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Overall Pretty Good Place to Work”
review.pros: Pros – The pros I would say are the extremely flexible hours and management is very flexible... I sometimes wonder if management is too leaniate sometimes. The employee discount is excellent, and it is a fun working environment.
review.cons: Cons – The cons would be that the pay is poor. I am considered a "sales support" associate, so I have one base hourly pay and do not receive commission. The personal shoppers or recently changed to "very personal stylists" are sometimes held on a pedestal.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay associates better.

review.title: “Would've liked to continue to work here but.....”
review.pros: Pros – Personally like the brand and really impressed with how Mickey has raised J. Crew and Madewell to the level it is now. He's smart and has great vision for the company. Would have been nice to be able to work more directly with him. Could probably learn a lot from him.Great discountsCo-workers were ok, some nice....3 weeks vacation & Summer hours (though rarely take advantage due to work load)
review.cons: Cons – There's not much work life balance for the lower level positions.....understandable in some respects (entry-level) but many times, too ridiculous with the amount of grunt work. They just pile it on....seems sometimes just for their own fun.There was one senior manager who was not very professional. Most of the time sitting around gossiping with the girls, whether it was about other co-workers or celebrities or did not talk to you or greet you at all if you were outside his small clique. Definitely showed favoritism, complained and whined often. Did not act like a senior manager at all. Hard to have any respect for him. He seemed to promote favoritism, his directs also had their favorites. My manager and associate mgr although nice, were very close and working under them was uncomfortable at times because of this.Almost everyone looks and dresses the same (maybe with exception of the designers - who have some uniqueness). 80% of the people are quite young and look like a J. Crew/Madewell catalog model. It's almost cult-like. You definitely need to drink the Kool-Aid to work there.They need managers who are trained to be managers, not young girls trying to be managers or tenured unskilled senior managers to handle conflict among co-workers. There were instances where 2 girls had a disagreement and loud enough for all to hear. But since the managers are not trained to handle situations such as these, instead, there is cattiness and favoritism. It was unpleasant to hear. Too bad Mickey never gets to witness these despite his frequent visits around the office floors.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Don't continue to retain certain senior managers just because they've been working there 15-20 years and dress in J. Crew head to toe. If they are not professional and productive, not sure that their loyalty is worth keeping, especially if they are not helpful to those he manages or the company.Don't be afraid to hire people who have some uniqueness and do not dress exactly like a J.Crew/Madewell catalog models. Definitely need some diversity in the company - different races, styles, age group, etc..... Yes, there are the token representatives (diverse) but definitely not enough, especially in their merchandising departments.Maybe once Mickey gets the company at a certain level, he can then concentrate on hiring more diverse and professional employees.

review.title: “Aristocracy at its Finest”
review.pros: Pros – twenty eight days of PTO, plus 6 paid holidays
review.cons: Cons – despicable pay, pathetic raises, reduced hours, no ability to be promoted without a college degree, associates are blamed for management's mistakes on a regular basis, no focus on safety, the philosophy is always quantity over quality, no training department, constantly over-hiring while simultaneously reducing hours, laying off seasonal workers every year by the thousands, even though we need some of the help afterward
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – quit pretending you respect hourly employees, we all know you do not

review.title: “Sales Associate”
review.pros: Pros – Discount was probably the best
review.cons: Cons – Didn't like working here. Pay was terrible. No opportunity for growth. Hours all over the place. Management was sketchy and formed a barrier between themselves and us.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Mature a bit!

review.title: “Nice for a while”
review.pros: Pros – Laid-back cultureGenerous discountGreat benefitsGreat location
review.cons: Cons – No room for growthThere is no one to turn to if you're having problems with bad management (HR is no help)Not much emphasis put on managers having people skillsNot very diverseFor a company that is doing so well, they don't pay competitively
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please train managers to know how to deal with people. Just because someone can do the job well enough to be placed in a high position doesn't mean they know how to manage people.

review.title: “Fun people, but micromanaging management, and not enough money.”
review.pros: Pros – Most of the people drawn to J.Crew are really fun and intelligent, so working with them is great. It's a good environment. They offer health benefits for part time employees, which is a wonderful thing that all companies should do.
review.cons: Cons – The pay is so little you can't support yourself with just a sales associate or cashier position. More than anything, there are always too few hours to go around to make a living, but you are constantly on call for them because they don't keep regular schedules, so you give your life's availability to them for around $600 a month.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It's hard to say anything to the store management because their hands are tied by the corporate requirements, but in general, I would say take it easy on your employees regarding corporate policies and nit-picky dress code requirements.

review.title: “Probably one of the best clothing retailers to work for”
review.pros: Pros – Great DiscountsCreative, enjoyable, and workable atmosphereGood Management and Upper level managementDecent pay compared to other retailersDiversityFlexibility in schedule
review.cons: Cons – Women workers get better promotions and discounts than the guys.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Great job hiring the people that will fit in well with the other associates it really make a family like atmosphere among all the associates and this vibe is felt by the customers.

review.title: “great place to work”
review.pros: Pros – great location & amazing culture
review.cons: Cons – long hours and poor communication from upper management
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – need to improve the onboarding process

review.title: “Sales Associate”
review.pros: Pros – The atmosphere is real laid back while at the same time providing a real professional setting, the discount is generous and the clothing is good quality. Easy to sell merchandise.
review.cons: Cons – They required you to wear a 3rd piece if you didn't have khaki's on which was a bit bothersome, but that's just me knit picking

review.title: “Overall a good experience, although retail hours are just awful”
review.pros: Pros – Got a pretty good discount! They were very good at fitting my personal and work schedule together.
review.cons: Cons – Spent a lot of my check on clothes. Hours were horrible.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Gotta like what you sell”
review.pros: Pros – There is a great discount for employees, as well as consistent hours if you ask for them. The people that work there are great and its a very energetic environment.
review.cons: Cons – A lot of managers are being brought in from other states which is great but after that happened, closings kept finishing later and later after 8pm. If you're fine with that you should be good! The promotion of managers and keyholders seemed to be a bit random and disorganized.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Upper management should be more attuned to their employees to earn their respect. It makes for a better work environment. Employees want to sell and see their numbers go up, but managers with less years at j.crew and experience is a bit demoralizing.

review.title: “High standards for medium-quality clothing.”
review.pros: Pros – Good insurance coverage, variety of options
review.cons: Cons – Medium-quality clothing and randomly high prices
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Lower prices!

review.title: “Working with a bunch of snobs”
review.pros: Pros – Okay. So the only reason there are 4 stars is because of the associate discount. IT IS CRAZY GOOD. Also, this would be the only reason I would ever go back to this company to work with as well. 0.5% Commission usually makes up for the taxes that deduct from your paycheck.
review.cons: Cons – These TERRIBLE things called on calls, where you are technically not scheduled but must have that time open anyways in case they need you and tell you to come to work. YOU have to call to check if they need you or not 2 hours before your scheduled on call. Also, SNOBBY, STUCK UP management. Like really, you manage at a retail clothing store.. get your head out of your butt please. your not that important. When you are shopping in your own time they do NOTHING for you act as if you don't exist. Making goal doesnt mean you are a good associate...management has to like you in order to be an outstanding associate and get more hours.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Seriously.... get a life.

review.title: “J. Crew has great clothes, not such great attitudes.”
review.pros: Pros – Beautiful clothes, excellent discount, styling tips, nice customers, good management.
review.cons: Cons – the sales associates are extremely catty and territorial, there is no incentive to do so considering you don't make commission, they act like "the cool kids," and you will constantly feel like what you are wearing is being judged.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – train staff to be welcoming, not excluding, to new employees

review.title: “Asheville NC Distribution Center”
review.pros: Pros – Great PTO(Personal Time Off), health insurance and discount on clothes
review.cons: Cons – In this environment, management considers everyone as equals, despite having some employees that either do more technical jobs than others without acknowledging through a higher pay scale for their knowledge and efforts compared to others that just show up. There is a severe lack of opportunity for advancement. I've been there for two years and make a little over $10.00 an hour.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Acknowledge that this low salary is a barely livable wage. Provide more incentive and opportunity for advancement. We can't all be power equipment drivers(they make more $ than most of the other workers)

review.title: “Great opportunity for young people”
review.pros: Pros – Friendly work environment, employee discount, flexible hours, great product, excellent management
review.cons: Cons – Crazy holiday season, closing can run late
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep doing what you're doing!

review.title: “It was a decent place to work.”
review.pros: Pros – Love the clothing, good discount, nice people, shorter shifts when working part time which was nice, flexible hours
review.cons: Cons – Typical poor retail pay and hours, hard to find a good run of sizes in many styles
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Better / bigger stock room for decent style and size run

review.title: “great place to learn about the retail industry”
review.pros: Pros – -employee discount!-flexible scheduling-great management-young vibe
review.cons: Cons – -typical cons of retail .. dealing with the public, at times unreasonable expectations
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Great environment and great people!”
review.pros: Pros – It's honestly a fun job.Awesome discounts.You get to meet plenty of interesting people.
review.cons: Cons – more hours would be nice!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I dont know about other J.Crew's but my managers are awesome

review.title: “Easy but miscommunication”

review.cons: Cons – inconsistencies. The supervisors were never on the same page and NEVER return phone calls
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Give the supervisors more training or teach them how to do the hourly jobs so they understand what is going on.

review.title: “good”
review.pros: Pros – the work is exciting and fast-paced
review.cons: Cons – I have a lot to do in a day
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Pleasant”
review.pros: Pros – I enjoy the people I work with and I love the company all together.
review.cons: Cons – Being a sales associate can be very tiring.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Great First Job”
review.pros: Pros – I loved learning the art of balancing school and a job with J Crew and they were always supportive of my schedule.
review.cons: Cons – Its retail, and I didn't plan on doing it forever
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Always interesting and exciting”
review.pros: Pros – Most employees are satisfied with their jobs - scheduling, pay and benefits are appropriate. Very fun environment to work in.
review.cons: Cons – As a sales associate the pay is not enough to live comfortably in New York City.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Offer information to employees about the product that is not available to customers through the catalog. A booklet with information including care instructions, intended fit, what happens after washing garments, etc. Customers trust a knowledgeable sales associate and not every associate can afford to own all of the clothes (which is currently the only way available for employees to have full product knowledge).

review.title: “Uncomfortable”
review.pros: Pros – Great benefits in regards to PTO days and health benefits. The ability to meet some great people and make some new friends.
review.cons: Cons – This box cannot contain all the cons to working for JCrew. I am aware that call centers can have cliques and friends but this is ridiculous. Jobs not being posted and given to upper managements friends. special treatment for those that hang out and drink with the managers. Working hard is not appreciated, and is often taken advantage of in this company. There are double standards for associates and leadership, I have seen some people get fired for the smallest infraction, and some people have been given several chances. Their is no leadership development in place which often leads to the company losing good associates to other companies. Probably 75% of the employees are looking for other employment.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – There needs to be an over haul of management, there are some in those positions that have no people skills or leadership skills. There are some that are excellent, however they are overlooked because they do not conform to the norm. Mickey you need to make some surprise visits so that the associates are not "coached" on what to and what not to say to you, so you could get the truth. That is if you want to know the truth.

review.title: “My experience with the new J. Crew outlet store in OpryMills Mall is horrible!”
review.pros: Pros – The only positive thing that I may say about J. Crew, is the fact the associates get an amazing discount. The job is very, very easy.
review.cons: Cons – Here is the downside about working for J. Crew. The pay is HORRIBLE!!! We as associates are barely making ends meet. The DM has changed their mind about giving fulltime to assoicates, even though we are still working fulltime hours. The level of respect from management to the associates, is down right rude, condensending and unfair. We are all grown ups that work in the store, but we are snooped upon and spoken to like we are children. We are made to feel very dumb and plain stupid. We as associates in this store, find the upper management to be very, very snobby and ill mannered. I have worked in retail for 17 years, and this job ranks as one of the worst jobs I have had. We work so hard in that store and we get the J. Crew cards and we are never given thanks. We worked over nights last week for the CEO to show up. He showed up alright, just not in our store. We were the last on his list and he had to catch his personal jet back home to NY. Talk about a major let down"(
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – My advice to managers- read the con section of this review.

review.title: “Good for Professional Experience, Bad for Saving Money or Having an Active Social Life”
review.pros: Pros – Fun atmosphere, good (or decent) discount on clothes, excellent if you are looking to work in a professional, fast-paced environment, empowerment in regards to customer service & assistance in certain situations, company growth brings some excitement to the product
review.cons: Cons – Poorly scheduled hours, lack of communication from management at times in regards to changes in policy & inventory, shortage of salespeople and/or cashiers at crucial peak hours (due to poor scheduling & foresight), high pressure on sales staff (and cashiers, even) to meet daily goals that are at times unrealistic, very demanding schedule during holidays & peak weekends with a shortage of regular hours due to "On Calls", fair amount of pressure to purchase clothes from week to week, work is at times shrugged off by both full-time sales staff & management with no consideration to sales support or cash wrap staff, pay is par for the course (slightly over minimum wage), at times there is no chance/moment to pause to catch your breath or to grab a drink of water (as the level of activity & traffic in the store tends to be somewhat overwhelming during peak hours)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – COMMUNICATION: Sometimes, it's all you talk about! (other than Goals). Follow that advice and ask your SUPPORT staff for key ideas on how to improve the efficiency of the store, inventory system, etc. They, along with your beloved salespersons, are the reasons for the company's success. Recognize their potential & don't use them up only to discard like tissues. The amount of respect & friendly concern you give to your customers should always measure up to how you treat your amazing employees, the ones who not only find what a customer walked in for that day & possibly more but also make the store look neat & up to standard each closing. So pay. it. forward.

review.title: “distinctive”
review.pros: Pros – Working at J.Crew has its own unique way to show you retailing. They give you a strong sense of a company is willing to strive for the best. The are willing to find new ideas and always looking for modernism however they always know their target market. And you get a great employee discount!!!
review.cons: Cons – Working retail in general has its general cons of not being very glamorous.That same goes for J.Crew not the best hours and breaking for 15minutes gives you no time to do anything and being in one store gets boring but that is most retail positions.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Management needs to be more open to learning who there employee are. Learning what there goals are or where they strive to be with a company will help with better positions because not everyone works great in sales or certain sections of a store.

review.title: “Fashion”
review.pros: Pros – Discount!!!! The discount was hands down the best part of working at jcrew. They obviously put a large emPhasis on what you look like
review.cons: Cons – Sometimes you could scheduled for inventory or rollout from 11pm to 5am. Only some people were required to attend these
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Good.”
review.pros: Pros – Opportunity, support, experience, good team environment.
review.cons: Cons – Limited hours, lower payment, limited positions in company.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep it up

review.title: “My experience at J. Crew was overall great.”
review.pros: Pros – Great benefits, amazing discounts, flexible with your schedule, A lot of informative information about the company and products, Usually coworkers are alway friendly.
review.cons: Cons – Had a wonderful manager, until he left and gave the position to a terrible man. Being promoted within was based on friendships, unfriendly, found reasons to get you in trouble. experience in that area all depends on your manager.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Give more direction when it comes to selling the J. Crew card. Help with selling techniques and giving details about products.

review.title: “good afterschool/college job”
review.pros: Pros – good after school/college job. the people that have worked in the company for awhile know have a system with how to run the store
review.cons: Cons – not enough hours, not very good management, better working chemistry. the employees have a hard time getting along with new hires and with management.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – management has to be more aware of how the employees feel. even though they are conscious of the environment they created, most of the employees at our store are not content with how the store is run.

review.title: “Enjoyable”
review.pros: Pros – Down to earth leaders, friendly environment, room for growth, incentives, stable job, training, great co-workers, flexible schedule, variety of shifts to choose from to work with your busy life, open door policy (sups and managers are open to any suggestions and feedback) company open for suggestions to better the company, CEO is down to earth and knows what he's talking about.
review.cons: Cons – Long hours during the holidays (expected), tedious work at times, redundant work (at times), calming down angry customers (at least 1 every 30 calls), constant phone calls.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Typical retail work in a really weird location”
review.pros: Pros – Some of the best reasons for working at J.Crew are the discount you get on the clothing, the pay is decent, and everyone is relatively friendly and easy to get along with.
review.cons: Cons – Retail can be a very political game. Sometimes the management choices were ones a lot of the workers did not agree with but somehow went through. Managers with little to no education on human resource management or management tactics.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – People do not want to work somewhere that they cannot grow. After working at this location on and off for around two years I was never offered a raise or a promotion within the company. This seems a bit weird to me.

review.title: “great, when there are hours”
review.pros: Pros – discount is great, nice atmosphere,
review.cons: Cons – hours cut after Christmas and agin in the summer
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “This was a perfect summer job, but only that...a summer job.”
review.pros: Pros – 1) Discount 2) People 3) Benefits
review.cons: Cons – 1) Long Hours 2) Poor Working Conditions 3) Poor Communications
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Need to detail job description more thoroughly

review.title: “It's better than most retail positions”

review.cons: Cons – very little opportunity to move up within the company, no commission on regular sales, corporate took away commission on new credit card applications
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “A fun workplace because I love the brand.”
review.pros: Pros – I like the work environment and the other associates and sales support as well as management are all quality people. The quality of the clothing is excellent and I love that the main focus is creating an experience for our customers that reflects J. Crew as a company.
review.cons: Cons – Sometimes the on call system is a little frustrating when trying to plan or schedule things. There are also times when business is pretty slow, but that's common in retail.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Just keep sales associates and sales support up to date with expectations and also with things that corporate wants to emphasize. Encouragement is also a plus!

review.title: “Vert satisfied”
review.pros: Pros – Fast pace, time flies when you're on the floor. Employee perks.
review.cons: Cons – Mall hours can be a pain
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Great work culture and excellent team work”
review.pros: Pros – Employee Benefits package is great.Compensationassociate discounts are awesomecasual work culture allows associates to work in a relaxed but highly motivated environment.Team supportTime-off
review.cons: Cons – A few technologies in place for technology job roles are outdated.Technology department should look for upgrading the existing ones and deploying latest technologies.Need to be process oriented.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – IT department should have an aggressive approach to adapt to new technologies.Over all it is a great opportunity to work for J.Crew.

review.title: “Exciting!”
review.pros: Pros – All of the different people you meet and make strong bonds with.Yes, it's work, but it's fun to work.
review.cons: Cons – It's a little competitive which can get stressful at times.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I don't think our store needs leadership advice because they are just so comforting and encouraging.

review.title: “J.Crew was a happy, up-beat place to work!”
review.pros: Pros – The job allows you to work with clothes and people, two things I like. The discounts and benefits are amazing. The hours are good and the management was nice to work with.
review.cons: Cons – Retail as a whole can be boring. Closing the store can be tedious, but necessary work. It was not J.Crew, but retail as a whole, that bothered me some.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Try to hire just enough people instead of too many people. It can be frustrating to get hired to work some where, but never get any hours.

review.title: “It was OK, but not great for a long career”
review.pros: Pros – Great discount when I worked there, meet diverse group of people and the visual merchandising can be fun at times
review.cons: Cons – Poor management, too high turnover, hard to get into corporate position, horrible hours.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – train and retain quality people with a competitive salaries

review.title: “Good”
review.pros: Pros – The work environment was very energetic and great. Also, there were excellent discounts that I took advantage of many times.
review.cons: Cons – For me, a major con was the lack of room for growth. I made it clear during interview that I was seeking long term growth. After several years, nothing but a small raise.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The management of J Crew is great at motivating and leading the group. However, they seem to not care much about the employees.

review.title: “Easy work with convenient hours but pays poorly if you're a man and definitely just a college job.”
review.pros: Pros – -great discounts-easy work-flexible hours
review.cons: Cons – -poor commission system-men's sales are ruined by crewcuts in the Lexington store
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “A fun atmosphere where I can where I can experience fashion from the retail point of view.”
review.pros: Pros – The associate discount is remarkable, the opportunities are pretty good if I were to continue working there. The consideration for employees needs is wonderful.
review.cons: Cons – The on-call slots can be inconvenient with an already busy schedule and sometimes the constant go go without a minute to rest can be wearing.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – As far as leadership goes I think for the most part, every trys their best to create a sense of equality and fairness that is amicable in the workplace.

review.title: “Satisfied as a temporary position.”
review.pros: Pros – J. Crew is a great company with hard working employees that pull out results and drives you to work at your best.
review.cons: Cons – There isn't much positive reinforcement or training given by the department which can be difficult for new hires and constant contractors who come in & out.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It would be a good idea to provide a more structured training program for new hires and contracts. In addition, there should be some positive reinforcement to encourage and provide validation to the employees so they know they are doing a good job.

review.title: “Very beneficial in improving my interpersonal skills.”
review.pros: Pros – The products are definitely above standard, it is clean professional look, very good discounts. J Crew partners with some very reputable brands such as Alden, Redwings and Filson to provide a wide range of apparel that can fit any individuals style. The hours working there are very flexible and works well if you just a little spending cash.
review.cons: Cons – As with any retail job, it is sales driven, and when sales are not so good, scheduling isnt as good. The stress of the customers can sometimes get to workers. It is a very competitive work scene so be prepared to hustle and maintain it at a high level
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Show more appreciation to all members of the team. Compensating only personal shoppers gives them a sense of unfair entitlement

review.title: “Mediocre hourly pay, great perks”
review.pros: Pros – Awesome discounts on merchandise (50% off sale items, 30%-50% off regular priced items)Employee sales contestsFun co-workersLaid back atmosphere
review.cons: Cons – Being on call some days makes it hard to make other plansLow hourly wageSeems difficult to get an increased salary wage
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Find a way to make sure the same employees don't keep winning contests so that everyone gets a nice perk once in a while.

review.title: “J.Crew is a great place to expand ones product knowledge and to gain experience in the retail field.”
review.pros: Pros – Your co-workers are generally friendly. Most are very down-to-earth and understand that everyone is working towards a common goal. If you work at a larger store, getting the time off that you need can be quite easy. The managerial staff is generally quite knowledgeable and willing to explain. Some of the personal shoppers are completely consumed with the world of J.Crew, this is rather refreshing and provides a positive working environment. If you're working full time at J.Crew, the benefits can be quite helpful - full time employees receive on average 20 payed days off a year and health/dental care plans are offered at a discounted price. Finally, the associate discount might just be the biggest plus. Employees receive 30% off regularly priced items, 50% off sale item, 5 wear-to-work items a month at 50% off, and there is also "The 60's List" - a list with various items (both in store and online at 60-75% off).
review.cons: Cons – Competition when selling is never a fun thing. Some of the associates are very serious about their daily goals and will stop at nothing to get there. I, personally have never been involved in an elevated situation selling-wise, but I have definitely witnessed many. The dress code can be quite ridiculous. Employees are required to wear a "third piece" when wearing jeans. This "third piece" is a jacket or cardigan. This can be a nuisance while working in the southern California area (yes, the weather is usually nice, but we all have those days...). The store can get very hot and forcing employees to wear layer upon layer of clothing is borderline cruel. Another downside is the scheduling. If you work at a small J.Crew location it can be virtually impossible to get a shift covered. I've also encountered some favoritism at my J.Crew. The managers tend to become close with the personal shoppers, you can't blame them, they are both full time positions and therefore spend a lot of time together by default. The only bothersome thing about this is favoritism when faced with making the schedule. Personal shoppers, or just well-liked employees, will receive prime selling shifts while everyone else is left with closing shifts. Finally, the commission system is not all it's cracked up to be. Unless you are selling MASSIVE amounts of product per day, you won't see much difference at all in your weekly paycheck.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The managers at J.Crew are all quite experienced in the retail field. In my almost five year employment period at J.Crew, I have never met a manager that I haven't liked. Managers are extremely well-versed on product, conduct and procedures. The only advice that I could offer would to be a little more understanding when it comes to selling. To compare a part time sales associates to a full time Personal Shopper is unreasonable and unfair. The associates, most of them any way, try very hard to make their goals and sell the product that they themselves truly love - please try and give them the benefit of the doubt.

review.title: “J. Crew”
review.pros: Pros – For fashion retail, J. Crew has to rank among the best places to work, they offer better pay than most comparable stores, an exceptional employee discount program and oftentimes a strong built-in clientele base that you can focus on building positive customer relationships with.
review.cons: Cons – The corporate numbers game of collecting phone numbers, e-mail addresses and even more extensive customer information can rapidly backfire. Sure, nearly every store is doing it these days, but unfortunately, the reality of the matter is that as often as you have a great experience with a customer, you're far more likely to take a good customer experience and turn it sour when you begin pressing for more information. If the focus was more on quality as opposed to quantity, I believe that over time you would create far more "great" customer experiences that turn into legitimate contacts.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The typical corporate numbers game of collecting a certain amount of phone numbers, e-mail addresses and even more extensive customer information can rapidly backfire. Sure, nearly every store is doing it these days, but unfortunately, the reality of the matter is that as often as you have a great experience with a customer, you're far more likely to take a good customer experience and turn it sour when you begin pressing for more information. If the focus was more on quality as opposed to quantity, I believe that over time you would create far more "great" customer experiences that turn into legitimate contacts. With some customers you build that trust on the first experience. With others, it takes a few visits to gain their trust enough for them to actually become a true "client." There needs to be more room allowed for sales associates to feel that out as opposed to being pressured by management to collect more information.

review.title: “The concept of "On Call" shifts is akin to indentured slave labor”

Employers now feel that they can treat employees as indentured slaves.- "Personal shoppers" are aloof, nasty, and uncommunicative. Most are poised at the fitting rooms to pounce on potential customers which in turn, creates a lot of tension on the sales floor among sales associates.- Stores have their own little clicks of workers - similar to a frat house mentality - if you don't immediately fit in, you never will. If these same people are in league with management, you may very well be doomed to "on call" shifts for perpetuity.
