review.pros: Pros – Excellent employee discountGreat employeesCasual work environment
review.cons: Cons – It's the holidays, so customers can be bad, but that's going to happen anywhere...
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Maybe set up more fixed schedules for temp/holiday employees... the hours are not reliable..

review.title: “great place to learn the business”
review.pros: Pros – people are hard working, very dedicated to the success of the brandpeople are very friendly
review.cons: Cons – no work life balancemanagers are great at managing the business, but not always good at mananging people
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – invest in training managers to manage people

review.title: “Baltimore, MD”
review.pros: Pros – Great clothes and wonderful discount especially on sale items. Good vacation time.
review.cons: Cons – Impossible to reach sales goals for store which is discouraging. Scheduling around personal life (i.e. school, special occasions) very difficult since schedules were scheduled week to week even for management- this may be different at different stores. Impossible to take sick time if actually sick.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Make it possible for employees to continue to work for you, it would lessen high turn over.

review.title: “Great part time job”
review.pros: Pros – The employee discount is fantastic and the management staff is great at communicating goals and congratulating employees on their accomplishments. Part time staff are eligible for health benefits as well.
review.cons: Cons – As with most part time retail jobs, the hours are not always consistent. Employees are also scheduled for on-call shifts.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Managers should stress the importance of open communication. Because associates work on commission, situations do occur where an associate's sale is taken by a coworker. Management should remind associates to communicate with everyone on the sales floor so that customers are not neglected and sales are properly credited.

review.title: “great place to work”
review.pros: Pros – If you like their product, then it's fun to see all of the new things that come in. The store is busy so there's no time for boredom.
review.cons: Cons – there was a time that the assistane managers were micromanaging while they stood around, but things have changed.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – :)

review.title: “The real J.CREW”
review.pros: Pros – Decent PayGood Health InsuranceNice Work BalanceGrowing CompanyNot StressfullGreat DiscountsLaid Back AtmopshereRoom to Grow
review.cons: Cons – Not very DiverseStill a Small CompanyNot a lot of StructureLots of young employeesLack of Clear Communication from Corporate
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I would like to see more diversity in stores, upper management, and in advertising. Also, more communication and training for all employees.

review.title: “J. Crew Associate review”
review.pros: Pros – Excellent employee discounts. Very flexible scheduling.
review.cons: Cons – Management gives conflicting direction regarding policies. Management does not communicate schedule changes. Management does not always communicate policy changes. Policies change often.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Management needs to agree on and communicate changes that affect employees.

review.title: “J Crew Seasonal Assembly/Packer”
review.pros: Pros – If you can get on with the company in the right position and Managment likes you personally you can get a job
review.cons: Cons – Must be someones friend or kiss major butt to get a job. not good work just kiss someones butt that is a manager
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat Seasonal Employees better. Tell them up front that they WILL be laid off. and let them know when. I understand it is seasonal but you know ahead of time that you won't keep all.

review.title: “Overall, working at J.Crew retail stores is fun and rewarding.”
review.pros: Pros – Good training, great customers, clothes that are easy to sell, good management
review.cons: Cons – Retail hours are sometimes difficult to accept, sometimes not easy to grow in a store environment
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Overall good management but can be a little bit more in sync.

review.title: “good”
review.pros: Pros – The company is ran extremely well on a corporate level. All of the Managers are extremely nice and I was happy with my experience.
review.cons: Cons – Tough to move up from the Sales Associate or in - house merchandiser to the corporate level within the company.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – To really look at some of the college students and employees that are really passionate goal oriented to succeed at a corporate level.

review.title: “Bitter Sweet”
review.pros: Pros – Great customer interaction. Wonderful product, and supportive management. Excellent reputationI enjoyed the people I worked with, they became family/friends in many ways.Management was very reasonable with time off, and giving the necessary support you needed as an associate and a person.Product knowledge and information widely available.
review.cons: Cons – Quality of clothing does not match price. As an associate this became difficult to sell that "j.crew quality."Upper management was not at flexible or understanding. Did not take the time to get to know each store more personally. VERY "Corporate"-- There is always someone you have to answer to.Corporate and Upper management could use to learn about servant leadership. It is not hard to get easily burnt out, because at the end of the day its only about profits.Very Bitter-Sweet experience.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More guidance, mentoring, and appreciation for the sales force. They are the lifeline of the company. Discounts are not everything.

review.title: “Not the greatest IT environment”
review.pros: Pros – Amazing benefits and time off, and a nearly unlimited budget to get things done. Management was quick to stand behind logical ideas and support their employees.
review.cons: Cons – Politics and backstabbing were the order of the day. Management was highly focused on playing favorites and it was clear who listened to whom.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Listen more and talk less. Allow people to go with the flow of what works if they can prove that it will function.

review.title: “If you have a tough skin”
review.pros: Pros – They have outstanding benefits. 5 weeks vacation to start and the CEO gives out 3 or 4 days off at random. They have Summer Fridays too. The staff is very talented and most of them agreeable to work with.
review.cons: Cons – The organization is non-existent. There is no clear chain of command and so much overlap between groups that most people aren't 100% sure who manages what group. The org chart looks like a connect the dots gone horribly wrong. There are a lot of strong personalities there and it's difficult to navigate the political waters. The informational material given during orientation presents J Crew as a big happy family where everyone is treated fairly and that is a complete lie. There are a huge group of people who are treated far better than the average employee.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Organize the company with a clear chain of command. Tell CEO to stop with the intercom, it's disruptive and not productive at all. Start truly treating everyone the same.

review.title: “OK for part-time”
review.pros: Pros – Great employee discounts. 50% off sale merchandise. 60% on a certain number of tops and bottoms each month. You get extra money if you open up new credit card accounts.
review.cons: Cons – Small 5 hr shifts, I found it hard to make that much money in a week even if you work everyday.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Train new staff better. I was trained when the store first opened and the training was much more thorough and helpful than it is for newer employees.

review.title: “J.Crew was a great place to work in the 90's when it was family owned.”
review.pros: Pros – J.Crew was a great place to work in the 90's when it was family owned. During the transition from private to public it was a difficult time. Once seniro management settled in, the company rebounded.
review.cons: Cons – Retail is a tough industry to command a high salary and receive a full bonus payout.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take good care of your employees and provide career growth.

review.title: “J.Crew”
review.pros: Pros – A great company with great people, and also great perks. It is a lot of fun to work at J.Crew
review.cons: Cons – Sometimes work requires very long hours, but this is common in all jobs, and it was not all the time, only on occasion.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – My only advice would be to keep up the great work and perhaps move to a building with a few more windows.

review.title: “Great Culture, No Training”
review.pros: Pros – -My managers and co-workers were respectful and competent-Work-life balance respected-Very positive work environment-Really great employee discounts!-However, experience can greatly differ from store to store
review.cons: Cons – -Barely any training (even when starting out)-No feedback-Little communication of goals and vision-Basically just a regular, boring retail job
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It's not enough to have great clothes! Management and employees need more training, more systems for feedback, and a better idea of the direction the company is looking to go in!

review.title: “Was a good company...”
review.pros: Pros – Discount is great. Very relaxed place to work.
review.cons: Cons – The pay. Everyone's pay was cut when the company went public.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Offer better pay for people and you will keep them around longer. You might have responsibilities to shareholders, but the same goes for employees.

review.title: “Decent”
review.pros: Pros – J.Crew was a great place to work during college. Flexible hours, fun co-workers, and great discounts. The pay was decent and the hours weren't too bad. I was still able to enjoy my summers (and got awesome clothes out of it).
review.cons: Cons – Management was alright.There wasn't much room for promotion (unless you wanted to devote your life to the J. Crew).
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Give better promotions or better salaries per hour. College students struggle as it is. It would be great for students to work, make bank, and then return the next summer. Makes hiring a whole lot easier if they worked there previously.

review.title: “Great Quality and Clothing! Not Great Quality in Management”
review.pros: Pros – - the discount is amazing.- the quality and style of J Crew is tops.- co workers are great and make working at J Crew fun.- it is a relaxed working atmosphere
review.cons: Cons – - the same management type is at every store. Management whom are overworked and to busy to give feedback and trainging to their employees because their main focus is to get ahead in the company or make their bonuses.- Management who are not trained properly themselves. They have no clue what HR is! No support from the Management for movement or wage increases.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – - Please begin a comprehensive training for Management. If you have such a program it is not shown with the management I have worked with.- Please begin to hire management who have ethics and morals not just a dedication to J Crew with power mongering intentions.- Allow your managers to be able to treat their store as their own business. This will better fit the dempgraphics of the store and may be able to gain more customers.I will not say if Mickey Drexler is doing a good job or not because, my main focus was management, and that is not where his speciality is. I believe his managers in Personel and HR are where they need to have more innovation. Help the managers stay motivated in their jobs, have monthly training focuses, and most of all make sure that the managers in the stores are reviewing their sales associates work preformance.

review.title: “Higher end retail will bring a different demographic of customers so be ready for them..”
review.pros: Pros – Clean, good environment, fair treatment between girls and guys working there, friendly managers, great location. You deal mostly with people who are well off financially, or their children. Keep in mind the types of customers that shop here compared to other retail stores of different styles or lower prices think they are special or expect top customer service because they are higher end shoppers.
review.cons: Cons – If you're a guy, get ready to try to sell in the womens department, knowing whether something shrinks or folding ladies jeans might make your voice tone raise a little higher and feel like you need a beer asap to go back to being a man.If you like to hear about what girls/some metro guys favorite colors are or omg something is just so so cute, this is the place for you.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – They're pretty cool no doubt, no complaints concerning management.

review.title: “Management stinks”
review.pros: Pros – Good discounts on their clothing (especially at the outlets, clearance center and on sale items!), flexible with hours especially if you are a student
review.cons: Cons – Poor senior management, treated people unfairly and many people left because of her "bitchy" attitude, although, she liked me I still couldn't deal with how she treated others
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Try to ask for feedback from at LEAST your assistant managers. Better yet, ask the associates who have been there awhile.

review.title: “Couldn't imagine working there full-time”
review.pros: Pros – Excellent employee discount, friendly atmosphere, very flexible work schedules. Great place to work if you just need some extra cash or are a student
review.cons: Cons – Good luck getting a raise as a part-time employee, even if you've been there for two years. And good luck becoming full-time, because they can't pay you, but expect to be asked to work full-time hours as a part-time employee
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Work harder to increase compensation for loyal employees; work on consistency in policies and how they are presented to employees

review.title: “An Overview of the Job”
review.pros: Pros – -Flexible Hours-Significant discounts on sale and regularly priced merchandise-Fun work environment-Interaction between employees and management
review.cons: Cons – -Must be able to multitask at all times, which sometimes becomes overwhelming when the store is busy, a lot of people are calling and a new shipment has come in.-Not all associates are motivated, so in many instances you have to do more that what is equitable-Store meetings were always very early into the morning
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Make sure to open communication between employees and the management as this ensures a healthy work environment.

review.title: “Great discounts and environment”
review.pros: Pros – Generous employee discounts, previews to upcoming products/marketing schemes, generous 100% discount on a few items to "wear to work" after 60 days of employment, the company prefers to assist customers and make sure they are comfortable, the sales commission is low (5%), the company does not put a high amount of pressure on associates to make a sale, but rather to insure the customer has an enjoyable experience. Sales associates are not expected to be "security" or confront anyone for loss prevention. A manager is always on-site.
review.cons: Cons – The health plan for part-time was cut; almost all of J. Crew's associates are part-time so this impacts a lot of people. Very few stores offer full-time positions. Some stores have outdated computers, which have frequent crashes. Parking is not validated or compensated for workers.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please consider adding health benefits for the majority of your work-force in stores: the part-time workers. Have a more structured training module for new hires: in my experience they are taught the basics of the store and thrown into the fray.

review.title: “Great opportunity for growth if you are a high performer.”
review.pros: Pros – Management really wants associates to become acclimated with the specific location, and climate of the company. Associates are given a level of training and autonomy rarely seen in retail. Great opportunity to create a client list and/or experience if one plans on parlaying J.Crew position into a career as a personal shopper at upscale retail establishments.
review.cons: Cons – Commission-based sales can create a highly competitive and at times tense work environment. The clientele is accustomed to a very hands-on, customer-centric shopping experience, and can be quite demanding and rude.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Police commission dishonesty (associates taking credit for sales that are not theirs) more . Find ways to invigorate associates who are low performing rather than saying "sell, and get cards, or you won't get hours."

review.title: “So so place to work if you're looking for part-time”
review.pros: Pros – laid back atmosphere, good compensation, good discount on quality clothing
review.cons: Cons – slow moving merchandise leads to a lot of downtime and not a whole lot of direction from management staff
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – find better ways to motivate sales associates, come up with some sort of incentive program to upsell

review.title: “Visit J. Crew store before applying for a job so that you can get a good feel for the store management and staff.”
review.pros: Pros – Every store has its own personality. I was very lucky to work in a very supportive store,where teamwork was paramount, however, our store management received little, if no support from above. This made communication of policies and procedures very sporadic and haphazard.
review.cons: Cons – Working "outside of the box" is difficult. Given the current state of retail, the ability to provide superior customer service can be compromised by lack of staff.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop the internal politics and be more supportive of the sales staff (hours, tools, technology, communication).

review.title: “Great discount, but hard to please.”
review.pros: Pros – J. Crew offers an amazing discount. Better, I believe, than most similar stores.
review.cons: Cons – Customers are so demanding and hard to please. Always want some sort of discount and are very fast to complain. We usually go out of our way to please customers and sometimes it is never enough.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – None.

review.title: “J.Crew Somerset Collection - A Google Place to Work”
review.pros: Pros – I was in graduate school and worked another job when I worked at the J.Crew Somerset Collection. The managers were flexible with my schedule and never questioned my requests. The staff was helpful and courteous and I made some excellent friends at this store. Employees are rewarded for hard work and goal achievement and I was awarded employee of the week during the 2005 Holiday season. I was given an opportunity to choose any piece off the floor I wanted. All in all, I would recommend J.Crew to anyone interested in the fashion industry. Good products, good people, good company.
review.cons: Cons – The downsides of working any retail position are commissions and sales goals. Normally kind and respectful people can become a bit territorial and step on toes in these situations. That part of it is not for me. I am not a confrontational person but occasionally ran into situations where other Client Specialists tried to "steal" my sale or work in my section of the store. I also didn't like that because of this "eagerness" many of the customers could tell it was a commission based job and were defensive when they walked in the door. This situation may deter some people from taking a job like this.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the good work.

review.title: “Not a great place to work.”
review.pros: Pros – 20 days off a week for full-time mgmt
review.cons: Cons – total disconnect between corporate and stores, unreasonable expectations as store level in terms of customer service and tasking on given budget and payroll. bad behavior is rewarded again and again...the wrong people continually get promoted within this company and talent is rarely recognized.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be realistic about your in-store expectations, make sure your personal shoppers aren't paid better than their direct managers, look closely at your review process, who is getting promoted and why. listen for feedback from your employees!

review.title: “Associates are the ones who do the sales but they don't see any results or improvements for their selves”
review.pros: Pros – The discounts. You get 30-70% on clothing and accessories. Also, they are very flexible for the hours you can work each week and you can still get a discount even if you only work a few hours per week or every other week!
review.cons: Cons – Schedules are not structured and even though you may work until closing, sometimes the store is not recovered on time, the markdowns are not finished or there is cleaning to do and associates have to stay till later than 9 in some cases. During the break there are no accommodations for associates ( in the break room) such as enough seating, enough space int he fridge to keep our lunch or dinner and anything to do after those hard working hours with customers. Also, the pay does not compensate all the heavy duty work to be done in the store.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Corporate Jcrew should evaluate HR policies in the Stores and reward and compensate associates more accordingly. Also, there are managers in the Store who do not have a college degree and are not bringing high level input to improve processes as well as leadership and management skills in the store.

review.title: “An OK Job only to Break Even”
review.pros: Pros – The discount is the best reason to work, however working in retail is counterproductive if you are trying to actually save money. Also, the factory store where I worked had amazing sales associates who were helpful, friendly, and had a sense of humor. The people at that particular location made work enjoyable.
review.cons: Cons – I was dissatisfied with the low entry-level salary. I excelled as a new employee and felt as though I deserved higher pay based on my educational background and success as a sales associate.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I wish that Senior Management had communicated better. I won a sales associate challenge, and promised to be awarded a $50 Associate gift card. Three months passed until I received it, and I only received 4 different J.Crew gift cards worth $10 each. I was very disappointed with how the Senior Management handled the situation, and felt that I deserved better treatment as both a J.Crew employee and customer.

review.title: “Good Discounts, Few Downsides”
review.pros: Pros – J. Crew is one of the few retail chains that prides itself on customer service and actually means it. Employees are not forced to badger customers and are, in fact, encouraged to simply interact with them like normal people. The segue into a sale becomes much easier when the customer does not start off his or her shopping experience being annoyed. J. Crew is well known for very high-quality clothing and is a great place to work when building a wardrobe for the corporate/office world. The discount is great, and you are NOT required to wear their clothing (a rare find in the retail world). This is not to say you are not required to project their look; rather, you can wear anything that does not advertise another brand or company. I met great people working at J. Crew, as well. Commission for client specialists is great, and commission exists for sales associates (but only on sales greater than a certain amount... I think it was $150, and it's meager)
review.cons: Cons – The on-call shifts are difficult, particularly if you have more than one job and need to have a more definite schedule. My on-call shifts were used some of the time, and I had them less often as a client specialist than I did as a sales associate, due to the nature of being a client specialist. It's still a major pain, though. Wear comfortable shoes because you will be on your feet on a hardwood floor for the bulk of your shift. I've never been in a J. Crew store anywhere in the country (and I've been to many) that had proper temperature regulation. You either freeze or you roast, but freezing is far preferable because J. Crew favors the layered look. People do steal sales, which matters a great deal because your performance rating is based on your sales level. As a client specialist, I had some great people who would watch out for my sales, but I was in trouble if they weren't working. When you're a sales associate it doesn't matter as much, but stealing a sale from a client specialist is a big deal because they all work on commission.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Store management always seemed fairly in tune with what was happening with the merchandise in general and with the staff. The corporate management needed to pay more attention to demand levels -- my store did a lot of catalogue orders (and/or lost a number of sales) because we never had the more specialized items, like cashmere and women's suiting.

review.title: “satisfied employee”
review.pros: Pros – J. Crew does an excellent job of listening to their employees and understanding their customers. Unlike, other retail environments, J. Crew allows sales associates to remain human and interact with customers on a one-on-one level, while maintaining a level of professionalism. The environment created by management is one that creates respect within, and begets respect throughout. Employees have a voice, and whether you want to move up, or voice a concern, matters are always taken into consideration. Of course, the discount is more than fair.
review.cons: Cons – Anyone who is not in management is subject to "On-call" shifts. These can be 3 to 8 hour shifts and there is no way to know if you are working or not but a mere 2 hours ahead of time.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The company has been around for sometime. Information is available to do thorough research to better gauge an understanding of shopping patterns per store location. Such as different clientele at each location, general traffic, and purchase patterns. This way, management is able to reduce or eliminate many on-call shifts, while still being able to balance payroll at each store.

review.title: “Um.”
review.pros: Pros – There were good discounts on their clothes. The people are friendly, and it helps your fashion sense. Every time you come to work, you dress to impress. Every sales associate are suppose to be a model. Since there was no commission, everyone was quite friendly. There wasn't any disputes about sales.
review.cons: Cons – The sales job did not align incentives well because there was no commission. Also there wasn't much to do as an sales associate. Other than bothering customers, folding clothes, and running the dressing rooms, the job is pretty boring. There isn't much the company can do about the situation.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep the employees motivated.

review.title: “Decent”
review.pros: Pros – Great discount, fun store environment, management is flexible with your availability if you are in school/other job, fun co-workers.
review.cons: Cons – Management can be inconsistent with rules making things confusing, VERY little hours usually 4-12 hours if you are sales support/associate and have open availability. Depressing looking at all the nice stuff but being too poor to afford to from the little hours given, on call shifts.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – hire less people to give more hours, be on the same page.

review.title: “Overreaching goals and overly aggressive mgmt”
review.pros: Pros – -Good discount-Good associates as coworkers-Nice clothes
review.cons: Cons – Management doesn't seem to staff the store properly and there are so little hours to be given and a large staff that needs hours. Mgmt also seems overly aggressive in trying to get their sales associates to make a high volume of sales (which if you don't make, your hours get slashed). The only people who get hours are management and stylists. Hours are far and few between despite having decent sales.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – If there wasn't the added pressure of high sales goals in a low volume store, this would be an ideal workplace, however that isn't the case.

review.title: “Fantastic.”
review.pros: Pros – Great, upbeat environment with friendly coworkers and managerial staff. Starting salary reflects on your previous experience. Also, I am just a big fan of the clothes - you get a generous discount.
review.cons: Cons – As I work in a fairly low volume store in a fairly quiet mall, I work about four measly hours a week. I would appreciate more, obviously.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Gimme more hours, guys.

review.title: “Great experience”
review.pros: Pros – Great discounts, getting to interact with customers and styling customers, amazing clothes and a story behind every piece
review.cons: Cons – Hours, pressure to sell or else you have little hours if you don't produce enough sales :'(
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be more open

review.title: “Immature and misguided management”
review.pros: Pros – The best part of working here is the discount. Though you can't make enough money to use it often
review.cons: Cons – The hours are completely ridiculous.On-Call shifts are never used.Management talk about associates on the sales floor.Management treats associates with no respect.The sales techniques used by management are too aggressive and often scare customers away.The store is always a mess due to understaffing.Management often disregard or talk badly about upper management. e.g. Merchandising manager talking badly about design concepts, telling associates how ugly some of the clothes are, trying to cut corners.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I really don't know where you find your management but just because somebody has experience or training does not mean they are qualified to be a manager. Being able to communicate with employees in a respectable manner is more important. Also having more employees so you can give them small shifts that are spread apart may be a fiscal benefit but the atmosphere of the actual stores suffer, and who wants to shop in a store where everybody working there hates it?

review.title: “Great discounts, overall good company to work for”
review.pros: Pros – Great discount, fashion forward product, overall I was satisfied with my job here.
review.cons: Cons – As with all retail jobs, there are things to grunt and grumble about, but most are in reference to the customer base.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Great part-time job in clothing retail!”
review.pros: Pros – Extremely flexible hours, managment in my experience has nothing short of outstanding. Great handle on work-life balance; you will never be guilted into taking on extra hours or taking on tasks that negatively affect your non-work life. Given the pay and the amount of hours available outside the holiday season, you will need a second job, but the company culture makes this extremely possible.
review.cons: Cons – Even with your 30-60% discount, most purchases are well out of reach considering non-managment pay. You are not required to wear J Crew clothing, but the dress code is very strict (a good portion of the men's clothing lines are not allowable under current guidelines). The path to promotion and developing a career within J Crew starting from within the retail side is hazy at best. Very female-dominated work culture, expect to feel out of place if you are a man, particularly if you are married and are in your early-mid twenties. Many of my co-workers and I have college degrees and are working retail for side/additional income, but no communication regarding career advancement is available. If given the chance, I'm sure many of us would take advantage of any opportunities for professional career development within the retail industry.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Fomalize the training process for support associates, particularly when it comes to backstocking and merchandising. Streamline merchandising procedures so that items are more locatable. Item locations can change multiple times a week, making tracking down customer requests a time-consuming and difficult task. Promote from within, and give your hard-working and educated associates opportunities to develop their leadership skills and provide a clearer path to career development.

review.title: “Amazing”
review.pros: Pros – The people are great. The work environment is fairly casual for such a large company.
review.cons: Cons – Training programs are still in development, so it can be a little overwhelming for the first few weeks.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “lovely”
review.pros: Pros – understanding management, fun team, good benefits
review.cons: Cons – retail hours, differencec between Canadian and American processes

review.title: “Amazing workplace!”
review.pros: Pros – Fast paced atmosphere, love working with customers and see loads of traffic on weekends and weekdays, management is fun to work with and trains very well, amazing discount!!
review.cons: Cons – Pay is mediocre compared to other stores nearby, but atmosphere and discount definitely make up for it.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep at it.

review.title: “best job i've ever had”
review.pros: Pros – hands on with fashion, best company, relaxed environment, beautiful clothes. I've learned so much about fashion and I'm doing what I love.
review.cons: Cons – pay, company only cares about personal stylist.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Being a Sales Associate at J Crew is Tiring”
review.pros: Pros – amazing employee discounts, people really like j crew so they are excited.
review.cons: Cons – you have to stand on your feet for hours, management can be demanding and disrespectful.

review.title: “Great Company”
review.pros: Pros – Great Pay, Amazing Benefits, Strong communication with corporate
review.cons: Cons – Heavy politics between Market Directors and Store Directors. A lot of dishonestly and the "blame game" when problems arise.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Look for the red flags and track records of your higher management - when you see a lot of employees leaving under their management its likely a good clue as to where a problem may be.

review.title: “Associate”
review.pros: Pros – Cool clothes, laid back, fun. The associate discount was amazing, especially at the outlet stores. I could get shorts / jeans / sweaters / dress shirts / ties, all for around $20 depending on the season. Not too many employee's worked at my store, so we all knew eachother and got plenty of hours.
review.cons: Cons – Management turnover was pretty high at my store. WIthin 5 months of being hired only one or two of the managers that hired me were still there.Sometimes the hours were too long. I would be asked countless times to stay late or come in early.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Collaboration with the schedule! Countless times I would say I couldn't work a certain day to almost every manager, put it in "the book", and I would still get asked to work. On weeks with limited availability I'd be scheduled to work almost 35hours, then when I said I had open availability I would get 8 because the right person never got word of the change.

review.title: “J.Crew is a fun, relaxed working environment.”
review.pros: Pros – The company offers a fun and relaxed working environment. The associates and managers are also great. The brand itself has elevated itself over the years, and the clothing gets better with each season.
review.cons: Cons – The only problem I have is the pay. No matter the starting salary or job performance, there isn't much improvement in hourly wages.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “J.crew”
review.pros: Pros – Nice people to work with
review.cons: Cons – Horrible management, do not make you feel good about your work.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Great for College Student/Part-time work”
review.pros: Pros – Being a college student, I can't say I would rather work anywhere else. Retail can be labeled "boring", but it's only a part-time job, and the pay is above average.The people I work with are great, with a good mix of college graduates, current college students, and some mid 40's women working at my current location.Willing to work with schedules; very flexible. Shifts range from 4 to 6 hours for associates usually.
review.cons: Cons – No real cons, considering its a well paying part-time job.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Good times, Bad times”
review.pros: Pros – Pretty good merchandiseGreat brand partnerships (Barbour, Alden, Red Wing, New Balance, Baracuta, Timex)Mickey is THE MAN! Love that guy!We had fun at work (although I hear there's a new regime that has outlawed fun in NYC stores)
review.cons: Cons – I have one complaint: I worked in NYC so people from JCrew Corporate came in to our store all the time (weekly visuals walk throughs for starters). Invariably they were arrogant and treated us with total disdain and contempt. They didn't seem to know or care about how the floor actually functioned because they never came in on a crazy Saturday afternoon. We actually had one guy from 770 (Corp office) that would come into our store, lock himself in the manager's office for several hours and watch the security monitors looking for employee violations (didn't fold enough, didn't replenish enough, forgot to clean out a fitting room, etc). Functionally speaking there are so many instances of abject failure that I can not list them in the space provided here. From merchandising to design, quality assurance, planning, allocation and distribution I've got examples of incompetence by them all. And yet they all think they are God's gift to retail in whatever capacity they serve. In general their attitude is deplorable towards floor associates.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – With all corporate employees getting half day Fridays during summer, it wouldn't be too much to require all corporate employees work one full Saturday or Sunday shift at a high volume NYC store (i.e. not The Liquor Store) each year - preferably during the fall / holiday when extra help is needed. Let them see first hand what it's like.

review.title: “No room for growth CALL CENTER”
review.pros: Pros – Sample Sales, Decent Pay, All you do is sit for 8 hours and take around 5 calls at the San Antonio call center. It's 10.75 HR (Not super great for a call center though)
review.cons: Cons – One mistake can get you fired. Sooo many people were let go for tiny reasons. I have my degree in Fashion Merchandising and HR still did not even consider me for the Personal Shopper position after a year of being in customer service. So if you work at the call center you'll always be just customer service theres no future with J.Crew
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get creative. Theres more to fashion than color-blocking. Give employees a chance when a mistake happens even a warning.

review.title: “Neutral CREW with Neon stripes”
review.pros: Pros – -Great clothes - store design-crewcuts --creativity
review.cons: Cons – -The intercom in the office is annoying - too many people in command who don't do the work-To many people with horrible attitudes - MICRO Managing is a big problem - People who work long hours, creative work, and that have passion are overlooked by people with big egos and people who can only talk and not produce great work - too many office politics ruin great creative people with talent - higher management is just bad in general - the company has gotten very reductive with design and less creative perspectives for new ideas-style guide need more fresh looks - Manhattan NY management is awful... the flagship store is the worst store
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Start listening to the people who work with you and do some work every once in a while.Talk can only get you so far

review.title: “great for short”
review.pros: Pros – Provide basic health insurance coverage for part time employees (at least in the distribution centers) so it is perfect for college students. It accepts feedback from customers and employees and often implements changes.
review.cons: Cons – This company is great if you know how to kiss up. If you do not, then you will never be promoted. Also, the mandatory overtime can become excessive especially if you have another job or you are in school and are already stretched to the limit.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The health insurance coverage for both part time & full time employees is great! If new duties are added to an already full job description, it may be time to create new positions.

review.title: “Flexibility, fun environment, and advancement opportunities make this a winning job.”
review.pros: Pros – Great clothingOffers part time benefitsGreat teamwork and management supportEasy to move up and advance within the company with many different types of aspectsAmazing discounts
review.cons: Cons – Lower management pay offers aren't greatI was promoted to management within the market but my travel time was increased by an hour and there was no room for pay negotiations based on that.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – CEO should not do announced store visits to see how stores are regularly operating with the hours that are given to them at the time.

review.title: “As a seasonal sales associate, during summer and winter holidays, I had a great experience working at J.Crew.”

review.title: “Great Company with a clear vision.”
review.pros: Pros – The longer I work for J. Crew, the more I like about the company. The company is continually pushing to improve itself. You can tell that senior management has a clear, and structured approach to grow the company's/brand's reputation and standing in the fashion retail world.I have a much better work/life balance since I have started working for J. Crew. I generally work 40-42 hours each week. There have been occasional weeks that I have had to work more, but for the most part, my work week stays at 40 hours. At previous employers, I would generally work a minimum of 45-50 hours in a typical week.
review.cons: Cons – Some of the systems of the company are a little dated, but as I stated earlier, there is a plan in place to modernize the company.
review.advice-to-management: – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Great place to work while in college”
review.pros: Pros – Place is fun to work at while in school or right after while looking for a "real job". Great discount allows for you to dress very well at all times. Pay pretty well for amount of work required. Work with cool, young group of people.
review.cons: Cons – Very unorganized company.They over hire for the store and weed out those who they don't like. Just because you get a job doesn't guarantee you will work much. Make sure you prove yourself from day 1.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Need to get more organized

review.title: “As a college student, this retail experience provides an inside look at the shopping patterns of educated professionals!”
review.pros: Pros – Great discount, health insurance, and 401k.
review.cons: Cons – changing schedule, and dealing with the public.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Relax, dont talk so fast.

review.title: “Bad hours, lack of respect.”
review.pros: Pros – DiscountLate wakeupsSome friendly employeesNot too much more else positive to say about the company
review.cons: Cons – Just about everything else!Competitive salespeopleOverpriced clothingNo foot trafficLack of respect for time! I was constantly on call–minimum 4 times a week, and I had to revolve my whole schedule around that, but I was almost never needed. It is illegal to have someone on call that much (I looked it up and it can be only 2 times per week in my state). The worst is that sometimes the night before they will cancel shifts or make them on calls if the store is not doing well. I know it's not because I am incompetent because it is happening to my coworkers as well, and I have been a successful sales person at another store.I'm an Ivy-League student but I was treated as though I was incompetent.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – RESPECT your employees! Do not constantly have people on call, but instead schedule maybe one or two on-call employees per day.

review.title: “Love J.Crew”

review.title: “Overall, J. Crew is a good place to work at as a student as least.”

review.cons: Cons – - my location is overstaffed; not enough hours to go around- some customers are rather difficult- very high store standards; hard to make the store look perfect- on-call shifts are irritating; hard to tell if you would be needed or not, which makes it difficult to create other plans
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – - Management is competent, but they should not hire any additional people

review.title: “Typical Clothing Store”

review.cons: Cons – Not enough hoursThey over hired at my locationTypical clothing store, so dont expect too muchGets boring afterwards

review.title: “"Culture"-driven Workplace Forces Employees to Pester Customers”
review.pros: Pros – -Typically lovely coworkers-Nice employee discount
review.cons: Cons – -force you to pester customers per the J. Crew culture

review.title: “Cool atmosphere, terrible scheduling”
review.pros: Pros – Management are nice and friendly and fairly flexible, including some senior management who will pop in from time-to-time, decent staff discount
review.cons: Cons – Hours are horrendous, scheduling completed weekly and at times only 1-2 days before the week begins, heavy use of "On Call" shifts meaning you never know if you'll actually pick up hours or not, and there is no hesitation by management to simply not schedule you for a week. Wages are low, associate commission is almost non-existant, and bonuses are only received when store meets plan (which is not always realistic).
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Bump up the hours and start scheduling bi-weekly. It's retail, so nobody expects to have really high wages but there needs to be a little bit of cooperation.

review.title: “Decent pay with nice mangers”
review.pros: Pros – The managers I worked with were nice and willing to work with your schedule. The company also offered a good employee discount and gave rewards for good sales and other accomplishments.
review.cons: Cons – I worked at a small store, so during off seasons most of my hours were "on call". Hence, you do not have guaranteed work hours.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – To the managers at the store I worked at.. thank you for being good and kind managers. Make sure to keep rewarding the staff, because it is good for motivation.

review.title: “the vacation package is awesome, however the management treats us all like uneducated neanderthals.”
review.pros: Pros – the ONLY good reason to work there is you get 28 days of vacation your first year, and if you are crazy enough to stay there five years, you receive another 5 days of vacation. we also get 6 paid holidays.
review.cons: Cons – we have absolutely no sick time available to us, unscheduled time off results in "occurances" that build towards termination; our hours are constantly cut back to 35 a week (the minimum gauranteed in the employee handbook); there is no actual training department, therefore associates are required to train other associates, without option of extra pay or recognition; we are required to cross-train in every department and meet production standards no matter how long it has been since you last performed any certain task; production standards on some tasks are unrealistic at best, laughable on others; the human resources department is a joke, catering to certain individuals and doing nothing for all others; management is terrible, they treat us like emotionless machines and hairless apes.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – quit cutting our hours and trying to make us output double production just so you can have the maximum bonus checks. be honest with us.

review.title: “One customer's smile or comment can make it feel worth it”
review.pros: Pros – Mostly part time positions. Good situation to have if you need to schedule work around another obligation.
review.cons: Cons – A lot of heavy lifting and cleaning.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Mickey, do you think the Health Dept. schedules upcoming visits? Try popping in and see what it really looks like. And, for a moment, put yourself in the associate's position. Really look at where they eat. Really check out the bathroom.. And! Store managers, try to remember you're not Nobel scientists who have discovered the cure for...whatever.....you are managers of a clothing store. Go on, do your best, but, a little humility would make for a more joyful atmosphere.

review.title: “They are a loving and caring, family company.”
review.pros: Pros – The management at J.Crew is superb as well as networking capabilities that you can gain while working with the company.
review.cons: Cons – The amount of effort you have to do to make sure the store is in perfect condition before the night ends.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue doing what you are doing, and remain loyal to your employees because we love the way management treats us at J. Crew.

review.title: “Great Experience So Far!”
review.pros: Pros – The J.Crew distribution center is a great place to build up your resume if your looking for experience. You are constantly engaged with customers from all over the U.S. and must quickly solve customer conflicts on a daily basis. This position also helps with communication skills, as you are on the phone through the duration of your shift. Proper usage of words and verifying important information is something you can take to any position you looking for in the future.
review.cons: Cons – Some of the management staff may look like they are not doing much. Their main purpose is to assist you if you have any major questions, which is helpful the first week on the call center floor. After that first week however, you may see them shooting the breeze with other associates while you are bombarded with customer calls. They are a great help, but it may be smarter to have conversations that are non-work related away from working associates.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Listen to new associate comments carefully. Some actually have great ideas on how to improve company performance. Also, try to help new employees get comfortable with other employees on the floor. New hires at companies often keep to themselves or only speak with other new hires like themselves. Get them involved with the rest of the J.Crew family so they have a more positive experience from the beginning of their hire date.

review.title: “Not a bad place to work.”
review.pros: Pros – Excellent employee discount program and plenty of staff training to make one feel connected to the company and its vision
review.cons: Cons – Retail work isn't always an exciting and fulfilling career, and with a small salary it can be downright difficult to stay positive
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the great communication with the staff! Try some new styles: I think we've all seen the same shirts and skirts for the last five years. Do something truly original.

review.title: “Fun environment, Educational, and Fashionable.”
review.pros: Pros – A few reasons to work for J Crew are the staff. They're fun and still getting the work done. A very diverse staff. Everyone seems loyal and friendly.
review.cons: Cons – The only downside is when they schedule you for oncalls. I would rather the company to schedule accordingly. Everything else is cool.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “not good.”
review.pros: Pros – discount is pretty decent. Work with fun people. Dealing with customer's is fun if you're good at it. The company is good at giving you time off if you need.
review.cons: Cons – managers are lazy and talk crap about employees behind their backs. My very first day of work, one of my manager's burst into the back room talking horribly about a customer. d

Be more genuine and real and understand the world doesn't revolve around how good your style is, and that people shouldn't be judged on whether or not they are wearing all J.CREW products.

review.title: “J.Crew”
review.pros: Pros – The discount is amazing and the company provides you with a lot of interesting product information. Commission is also a definite perk.
review.cons: Cons – The management team is pretty lax in terms of helping associate meet their selling cost goals. It's also difficult to meet selling goals when total store sales are declining.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Make a bigger effort to encourage and coach associates in sales and customer relations. Stay on top of relaying all product and policy information to employes immediately.

review.title: “Be nice”
review.pros: Pros – Fun environment. Easy going group with quality product. Makes it easy to market. Commission on big orders is not bad and employee discount is good too
review.cons: Cons – Not the best place to work if you get tired of looking at fashion all day. I can be boring and dealing with customers is not always fun
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – No a whole lot to say. Management was always great. Usually some leery smar talented people there and i liked it

review.title: “Trade off: Happiness for modest income”

review.cons: Cons – Modest pay, strict/stifling dress-code, little room for upward movement, erratic schedule interferes with overall quality of life
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “It's an under-paying, uncomfortable resume-builder.”
review.pros: Pros – The people are generally good at what they do. People are especially intelligent and some of the best in the industry. You're likely to look good at the end of the day.
review.cons: Cons – The culture is full of whispers and gossip (then again, so is the industry). The pay is among the worst in the industry.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Create a team atmosphere where people actually enjoy working together instead of defending themselves and their work. More emphasis placed on team-building would likely lower the turnover, gossip, and self-interest. More competitive pay would also keep everyone around a lot longer.

review.title: “While I love the product and the overall atmosphere in the store, the pay and incentives are pretty meager.”
review.pros: Pros – Great clothes, great employee discount.
review.cons: Cons – Terrible hourly rate, weak incentives, and little room for growth. More appropriate place to work if you're 18-21 and looking for part-time work.

review.title: “Great to work for, store management needs to be looked at by district managers”
review.pros: Pros – Health BenefitsAssociate DiscountGreat Contest Prizes
review.cons: Cons – Management ScheduleHigh credit card opening goalsHigh sales goals per hour
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take a look at your store level management on day to day operations. You will notice that not everyone is given office time when needed. It's the same people always out on the floor, same people always in the office. The schedule is never fair. Its the same people closing several nights a week and the same people always opening. Or certain people always closing weekends.

review.title: “My experience at J. Crew has been amazing.”
review.pros: Pros – They are all very, very friendly. They are easy going and yet they get the tasks they need done accomplished soon.
review.cons: Cons – There really are no downsides to working at J. Crew. I love working there. I would work there all the time if I could honestly.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The leaders of J. Crew are all very cordial to their customers and employees. I offer no criticism towards the leaders.

review.title: “Sometimes I love it, sometimes I can't wait to get out of there.”
review.pros: Pros – Atmosphere is amazing, people are incredible, a great way to learn a lot about fashion and to meet new friends - both within and outside the company, Associate discounts are quite nice as well.
review.cons: Cons – Pay is terrible, no joke! For the amount of work we do and all hours we put in, I'd love to start getting paid more! Retail hours are terrible in general - so that's a nobrainer. Upper levels prefer to overlook a lot that goes on within certain stores, even after hearing a lot of complaints from employees and receiving many emails and calls through open talk. Some managers are unmanageable themselves, if not to say more: it is, unfortunately, a proven fact at this point, yet seniors choose not to do anything about it.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Start hearing us out, really listening to us, caring about us and doing something to improve certain situations. Once you do that, we will be way happier and happy employees are a key to successful business ventures!

review.title: “wholesome sales job with good customer service”

review.cons: Cons – mainly only part time work

review.title: “It's an absolutely, amazing company to work for.”

review.cons: Cons – Not always busy with customers, sometimes gets slow. Clothes can be pretty expensive. Every now and then, on call shifts are given.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – So far i really enjoy working for J. Crew and plan on staying and hopefully moving my up. It's a really great environment, keep up the great work!

review.title: “My experience at J. Crew has so far been positive.”

review.cons: Cons – Hourly pay-rate is a little lower than the average for part-time employees.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “An okay work environment, but not worth the effort.”

review.cons: Cons – Hours are sometimes very low and can vary widely from week to week. Management also tries to keep shifts in the 4-5 hour range, which can be annoying if you have much of a commute. The use of on-call shifts can be nerve wracking as well, as it really limits your ability to make plans.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Try to make sales associates feel more valued. It's hard to stay motivated when turnover is so high that you can't even keep up with your coworkers.

review.title: “Fun and excellent place to work.”

review.title: “Fun and fashion forward retail store to work at.”

review.title: “My experience at J. Crew has been good.”

review.cons: Cons – Standing and folding a lot, staying late nights for roll out.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Should start rewarding employees who make a lot of sales.

review.title: “I love it”

review.cons: Cons – The customers can be very annoying. They try and tell you something is wrong when absolutely nothing is wrong especially when they cannot return certain items.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I think that some things they do are very good in creating a better company. However, I do not like how they have us focus on different things at different parts of the year.

review.title: “like working with clothing”
review.pros: Pros – The people that we meet every day.
review.cons: Cons – Everything we get in shipment comes in plastic bags. Never get a run of items, always the same sizes sent. Not all customers are a 0 or 2 and they get upset when we don't have item. Wish our registers could keep up with what it sold and send item to replace, not stuff we have enough of.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Let us know if we are doing a good job. Work with us more. Explain the way J. Crew would like things done better. I know sales people come and go and it makes it hard to keep up with what was said to who.

review.title: “Fantastic environment to interact with people.”
review.pros: Pros – you meet new people every day. you learn about style and therefore get a good sense for fashion. You learn how to dress and be versatile with your wardrobe. The people you work with, at least in my store, are always in a good mood and willing to help out. Its also good to receive compliments when customers like the outfit that you are wearing. It makes you feel good, and it makes them think about possibly getting that item for themselves as well.
review.cons: Cons – When it gets busy, it GETS BUSY. but that's just part of the business. Sometimes customers might think they are royalty, but you learn to deal with that type. Overall, the only con I can think of is closing time when people in the store come in, make a mess, and don't buy anything. They make you clean up their mess. Then again, that's what you're getting paid to do.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Not all, but at least for some, when you talk to an employee, and you just got promoted to a "key holder" don't talk to us as if you've been a manager for 8 years and give us that sense of superiority when delegating, explaining, or informing us of certain things. ANYONE can be a key holder, don't think that you just got promoted to vice president or CEO of the company.

review.title: “Amazing Employer with Great Benefits”
review.pros: Pros – -Amazing discounts-Wonderful part-time benefits-Highly flexible-Great co-workers-Emphasis on friendliness-Emphasis on personal responsibility-Strong emphasis on product quality and superiority
review.cons: Cons – While the senior, corporate management is extremely competent and well-heeled, such adjectives (as in any industry) don't always apply to the local, on-the-spot management. While this hasn't posed any real problems as of yet, there have been some instances where local management's messes have had to be cleaned up by corporate.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “It was my first job in retail, and I absolutely love it, I think J. Crew is a great company to work for”

review.title: “Better place to work compared to other retailers...”
review.pros: Pros – Most of my co-workers were nice and the managers were enthusiastic, respectable, and professional. The company does take the time to recognize successful employees for both their small and great achievements (good customer service, a fantastic sale, etc.). The managers were very good about making sure employees took breaks according to legal standards.There are many different positions - stock support, cashiers, sales associates, etc. If you like variety, there's opportunity to move around and try different things.As a store with a big fan following, many customers adore the product and are a pleasure to work with. The company encourages you to go the extra mile to make it a great experience for the customer, so they do let you take ownership in dealing with many issues, and your hard work is often rewarded with loyal, appreciative customers.The employees with full-time positions (personal shoppers, visual assistants, etc.) were good at what they did and seemed happy working there. The benefits for full-time employees is good. (There are benefits for part-time employees, but it's not that great.) J.Crew is a good place to work part-time for students or people just looking for something to do. The employee discount is a reason to work there by itself!I left when I found a full-time job elsewhere, but if my circumstances change later in life, I'd definitely consider going back to help with shipment and rollout (it's fun being the first person to see the new stuff, and the hours are more consistent).
review.cons: Cons – If you depend on your job for income to pay bills, the hours you may need aren't always available. They schedule a lot of on-call shifts - the penalty for not calling is the same as not showing up for work, but you get no reward for being prepared to work that shift. If you do want more hours/have a more open availability, the hours you get can also be all over the place - you may close late at night and then be back to open bright and early. This can be especially rough during extended holiday hours. You also will be expected to have some sort of weekend availability - but that's standard in retail.The pay is moderately fair - probably better than many retailers, but nothing to get too excited about.The company also has a lot of standards for folding, hanging clothes, etc. While I admit a certain fondness for a perfectly folded stack of sweaters, the 2-3 hour closings that are necessary to create those picture-perfect piles can be a bit tedious.My biggest disappointment with the company was the lack of education about policies and products - I had a short orientation with the handbook and a cheesy video, and from there figured out a lot by myself (no shadowing, etc.). I'm sure that a lot of this has to do with the high turnover rate in part-time retail.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Offer a merchandise locater in your stores. Make the prices on the website and in the store consistent!
